TextView.android:text: Objective of this app is to give you the ability to check accuracy of your wrist watch. \nOur app has an accurate system watch which is used as the reference.

You need to perform following steps to achieve the objective. 
- Add your Watch 
- Track Watch 
- View track history to check watch accuracy

Click on ‘My Watches’ in footer menu. 
Then click + icon. 
Enter name of watch. 
Take picture of the watch. 
Click ‘Add’. 
It will be added in My Watch List.

- Click on ‘My Watches’ in footer menu. 
- Click on ‘History’ button for the watch. 
- Tracker screen will open with phone’s camera on and app’s reference watch with only Seconds hand in it. 
- Start and Restart button is there on tracker screen. 
- Clicking on Start button will start the tracking and button will change to “Stop”. 
- Before starting tracking, you need to super impose the app’s reference watch on to your wrist watch. 
- As soon as your wrist watch’s second hand reaches zero and matches the static second hand of the app you need to start tracking. 
- After a few hours have passed, when you are ready to stop the tracking, then again, you need to super impose the app’s reference watch on to your wrist watch. 
- Clicking on “Stop” button will stop the tracking. 
- When tracking is stopped, a screenshot is taken by the app and is saved in history of the watch. 
- This screenshot show app’s reference watch along with your wrist watch. It will show time of tracking and elapsed time of tracking. 
- Based on position of ‘Seconds hand’ of your wrist watch and app’s watch in the screenshot, you can check the accuracy of your watch. 
- If both are on same position, your watch is accurate.
How to view Tracking History of a Watch

Click on ‘My Watches’ in footer menu. 
Click on ‘History’ button for the watch. 
Tracking History of the Watch will be displayed. 
Record will show time of tracking and elapsed time of tracking.
